t: Scion Vehicles: Prices, Reviews & Pictures | U.S. News
s: Scion was a Japanese manufacturer owned by Toyota. Technically, Scion has been discontinued, though the Scion brand and many of its models were folded into Toyota. For example, the iA sedan became the Yaris iA, which was in turn absorbed into the Yaris.

The Scion brand started as a youth-oriented division of Toyota, offering smaller, less-expensive coupes and hatchbacks with sportier designs. Some Scion models gained mainstream appeal, but the brand was discontinued and absorbed back into Toyota in 2016. The Scion iM was rebranded as the rebadged ...

November 30, 2024 - Scion, a former marque of the automotive conglomerate Toyota, sold eight different small car models during its thirteen year existence in the North American market. All of its vehicles were mechanically related to or outright rebadgings of other cars sold under the Toyota brand.

t: A Brief History of Scion – ClixAuto
s: November 16, 2023 - Scion was a sub-brand of Toyota that was introduced in 2003. The brand was created to appeal to younger drivers and to offer more affordable and customizable cars. Scion's first car was the xA, which was a small hatchback that was designed to be fun to drive and easy to customize.
